item.title: The resilient stock market may be keeping the economy out of a recession. Why that's a bad thing
item.description: Consumers with larger stock holdings are feeling fine, while those with smaller or no holdings are not.

item.title: Core inflation rate held at 2.9% in August, as expected, Fedâ€™s gauge shows
item.description: The personal consumption expenditures price index for August was expected to increase 2.9% from a year ago.

item.title: U.S. expands tariff dragnet to masks, syringes and robotics in sweeping import probe
item.description: The Trump administration has launched investigations into imports of robotics, industrial machinery and medical devices, paving the way for fresh tari...

item.title: Jobless claims tumble to 218,000, well below estimate despite fears of labor market weakness
item.description: Initial claims for unemployment insurance were expected to total 235,000 for the week ending Sept. 20.

item.title: U.S. Latino immigrants generate $1.6 trillion in GDP, report says
item.description: Mass deportations of undocumented workers could cause GDP to decline by $2.3 trillion, or 7.7%, in 2025 dollars, according to the report.
